citeinfo.origin: Kevin Coyne , FDEP, Division of Environmental Assessment & Restoration (DEAR) , Environmental Administrator
citeinfo.title: Statewide BMAP General Areas

descript.abstract: A BMAP (Basin Management Action Plan) is a water quality restoration plan prepared pursuant to Section 403.067(7) Florida Statutes. BMAPs are designed to reduce pollutant loadings to achieve the limitations identified in an adopted Total Maximum Daily Load (TMDL) through a comprehensive set of management strategies - permit limits on wastewater facilities, urban and agricultural best management practices, conservation programs, etc. These broad-based plans are developed with local stakeholders - they rely on local input and local commitment - and are adopted by Secretarial Order and are enforceable.
descript.purpose: To spatially represent the areas where a BMAP is being prepared and areas where a BMAP is adopted. The purpose of this layer to show the land areas subject to a BMAP and the water areas that are being restored.
descript.supplinf: BMAP Standing/Status Values: BMAP Adopted / Adoption Pending: BMAP Adopted - The BMAP has been adopted by the Secretary and stakeholder implementation is underway. Adoption Pending - A process to prepare a BMAP is underway; the BMAP is not yet adopted.

timeperd.current: Date data was updated in the GIS library

idinfo.useconst: Use is limited to showing approximate feature delineations. This layer is not intended for legal decision making. BMAP Boundaries are subject to change during development stages and are not final until adoption of the BMAP.

procstep.procdesc: Existing BMAP Project shapefiles from the November 2010 update were edited, updated and merged into one streamlined shapefile. BMAP Project Boundaries consisting of multiple shapefile records were dissolved into shapefiles with single records. Updated boundaries were verified for accuracy by way of direct communication with Basin Coordinators. Corrections and adjustments were made as needed.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) OTIS/GIS Section

procstep.procdesc: Updates for July 2011 BMAP have been incorporated and final BMAP Project updates have been verified. Submitted as a new SDE Layer
Added new layer in ArcSDE. Metadata updated, data published in DataMiner
Updates and revisions for October 2011 BMAP have been incorporated and verified.
Submitted for SDE update
Updates and revisions for June 2012 BMAP update request have been incorporated and verified. Wagner Creek removed.
Santa Fe BMAP boundary updated by RH for Terry Hansen

Updates and revisions for December 2012 BMAP update request have been incorporated and verified. Indian River Lagoon boundary has been removed and replaced by Banana River, Central Indian River Lagoon and North Indian River Lagoon. Rainbow Springs/Rainbow River and Silver Springs/Silver River have been added. Hendry Creek and Imperial River are now seperate boundaries. Contacts have been revised.
Submitted for SDE Update
Updated data in SDE and symbology. Metadata updated

Caloosahatchee: Referenced WBID boundaries to fill in the river portion on 20130107 with Beth Alvi's approval. RH changed Status from Adoption Pending to Adopted after checking FDEP BMAP page. Everglades West Coast Basin (Formerly Hendry Creek and Imperial River respectively): Hendry Creek and Imperial River were split into separate boundaries on 20121024 at Anita Nash's request. Hendry Creek was updated, regrouped with Imperial as one boundary and Renamed Everglades West Coast Basin on 20130107 at Anita's request. RH changed Status from Adoption Pending to Adopted after checking FDEP BMAP page. Silver Springs and Silver River: Edited using Silver Springs springshed polygon from groundwater section on 20130103. This boundary could change in the future. Rainbow Springs and Rainbow River: Edited using Rainbow Springs springshed polygon from groundwater section on 20130103. This boundary could change in the future. Upper Wakulla River (Formerly Wakulla River, Munson Slough and Lake Munson): Combined WBID 1006 with Wakulla Springshed from groundwater section and changed name to Upper Wakulla River on 20130108 for Anita Nash. Lake Okeechobee RA Plan: Revised 20130111 using a shapefile obtained from Kim Jackson at request of Anita Nash. Coincides with Lake Okeechobee BMAP boundary. Revised again on 20130215 using shapefile from Kim. Lake Okeechobee BMAP: Created on 20130111 using a shapefile obtained from Kim Jackson at request of Anita Nash. Beth Alvi confirmed that she will be Basin Coordinator. Coincides with Lake Okeechobee RA Plan boundary. Revised again on 20130215 using shapefile from Kim. Wekiva: Revised the boundary to include the groundwater portion on 20130122. Initially notified of the error by the Eric Hicks in the Groundwater section. Shares space with Upper Ocklawaha. Lake Tohopekaliga: Acquired shapefile from Beth Alvi whose data source was Kimberly Lawrence from Osceola County Public Works on 20130111. St. Lucie: Updated on 20130110 at request of Anita Nash. Central Indian River Lagoon: Revised 20130110 for Anita. Gottfried Creek: Deleted on 20130122 at the request of Anita Nash. It was determined that Walk the WBIDs should be on a separate layer. Santa Fe: Re-edited on 20130129 for Terry Hansen at request of Anita Nash. Changed Status from Adoption Pending to Adopted for Anita. Tampa Bay (RA Plan): Revised 20130129 at request of Anita Nash. Used a shapefile obtained from Ed Sherwood from the Tampa Bay Estuary Program. Alafia River Basin: Revised for Anita Nash on 20130129 using Alafia River Planning Unit from Run 41. Suwannee BMAP boundary updated on 20130215 using new shapefile sent by Yesenia Escribano on 20130214. Shapefile was edited to match the edge of the edited Santa Fe BMAP boundary at request of Terry Hansen. Unnamed Branch deleted on 20130305 at Anita's request. Deleted lake Okeechobee "Areas undergoing Restoration Supporting TMDL Implementation" since the BMAP is now underway at Charles Gauthier's request on 20130306. Created Jackson Blue Spring on 20130306. Official BMAP yet to be determined. Composed of WBID180A and WBID180Z. Updated Wakulla Springs BMAP on 20130322 using information from Anita Nash. Submitted for SDE update with updates to shapefile, metadata and layer file on 20130412 by RH.

20130703 - St. Lucie BMAP status was changed to Adopted at request of Charles Gauthier. 20131216 - Rainbow Springs/Rainbow River BMAP Boundary was updated and the status was changed to BMAP Activities in Progress at request of Terry Hansen and Charles Gauthier. Submitted for SDE update.
Updated data in SDE/DataMiner. Metadata updated

20140103 - Added DOC_NAME (Document Name) field to the shapefile table at the request of BMAP section. 20140103 - Removed "Anticipated Basin Management Action Plans" and "RA Plans and Other Non-BMAP TMDL Implementation" STATUS classifications at the request of Charles Gauthier. This means that only "Adopted Basin Management Action Plans" and "Anticipated Basin Management Action Plans" will remain. 20140117 - Revised Lake Okeechobee BMAP at request of Anita Nash and Beth Alvi. Revisions are still underway at this time but Beth Alvi has put in a special request to submit this shapefile to SDE today.
Data updated in ArcSDE/DataMiner. New field 'DOC_NAME' added in attribute table.

20140212 - Alafia, Manatee, and Hillsborough BMAP boundaries are now represented by WBID areas instead of the larger basin area. 20140212 - Lake Okeechobee BMAP had the Lake Okeechobee water body placed back into its boundary. 20140212 - Lake Harney, Lake Jesup, St. Lucie and Lake Okeechobee boundaries now include the water bodies as well, which keeps with the Statewide BMAP General Areas theme to represent the entire BMAP area, both land and water, where a BMAP is being prepared or adopted). 20140212 - Alafia and Manatee BMAP Basin Status has been ugraded ot Adopted. 20140212 - Long Branch, Lake Jesup, Lake Harney / Monroe, and Wekiva BMAP basins have been assigned to new BMAP Coordinator Moira Rojas. 20140312 - The Metadata Abstract and Purpose has been updated. 20140312 - The Metadata Entity and Attribute Overview Description and Attribute Domain Values have been revised. 20140319 - Submitted for SDE update with DataMiner layer name changed to Statewide BMAP General Areas.
Data updated in SDE/DataMiner. Display name changed to Statewide BMAP General Areas.
Jackson Blue Spring, Kings Bay and Crystal River Springs and Weeki Wachee have been added to the layer. They are BMAP Activities in Progress. Submitted to SDE on 20140703.
Data updated in ArcSDE and DataMiner. Metadata updated

20140723 - Added Volusia Blue Springshed BMAP Boundary. 20140730 - Updated Jackson Blue Spring BMAP Boundary. Removed portion that extended beyond FL state line and added a previously cut out corridor in the southwestern portion of the BMAP.

procstep.procdesc:
Added Wacissa BMAP boundary for Terry Hansen using spatial and tabular information from Talia Smith.
Introduced Wekiwa Spring and Rock Springs as its own BMAP boundary and reintroduced the Wekiva River (Wekiva River, Rock Springs Run, and Little Wekiva Canal) BMAP boundary at the request of Moira Homann using data provided by Talia Smith.
Added "TYPE" field at Greg DeAngelo's request. Its purpose is to distinguish between Spring BMAPs and Surface Water BMAPs (rivers, lakes, estuaries, etc.). Populated field with either a value of "Spring BMAP" or Surface Water BMAP.
Renamed the value within the "STATUS" field from "BMAP Activities In Progress" to "Pending BMAPs" at Greg DeAngelo's request. Updated layer file to reflect this change.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) DEAR, Watershed Services Program

attr.attrdef: Contact phone number of BMAP Manager
Area measured in acres. Calculated in Custom FL Albers Projection.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The FDEP Regulatory District that the BMAP boundary is associated with.

The BMAP Project Name shown on the map entitled TMDL Implementation: Basin Management Action Plans and other Water Quality Restoration Activities. Represents commonly used names for the BMAP projects.
Date that BMAP spatial boundary was either submitted or updated.
Notes pertaining to the BMAP project
Current stage within the BMAP developmental process.

edom.edomvd: The BMAP has been adopted by the Secretary and stakeholder implementation is underway.
A process to prepare a BMAP is underway; the BMAP is not yet adopted.

attr.attrdef: The Parameters being addressed by the BMAP basins.
attr.attrdefs: DEP, DEAR, Watershed Planning and Coordination Section (WPCS)

attr.attrdef: Standardized BMAP document name to be used in current and future BMAP documents.
The name of the TMDL Basin Rotation Group that the BMAP boundary lies within
The waterbody type value used to distinguish between Spring BMAPs and Surface Water BMAPs (rivers, lakes, estuaries, etc.).
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntorgp.cntorg: Florida Department of Environmental Protection (FDEP) OTIS/GIS Section
